instruction: Given a text passage as input consisting of dialogues of negotiations between a seller and a buyer about the sale of an item, the task is to classify the text into one of the labels from the two possible outputs - 'accepted'/'rejected'. Select [accepted] if by the end of the conversation the buyer seems likely to buy the item from the seller. A sale is likely made when the buyer and seller agree upon a common price or when a deal is made between them. Select [rejected] if the buyer did not seem interested in buying the item from the seller at the end of the conversation. This happens when the buyer and seller do not agree on the price or other aspects of the item being sold by the seller.
input:
Seller: Hi! You like the looks of the house?
Buyer: I do, although I am on a fixed income.
Seller: I'm willing to negotiate, so long as it's reasonable. 
Buyer: Well, I'm afraid since I'm disabled I can only offer you $1020 a month. On the other hand since I get a disability check each month I can guarantee that's direct deposited each and every month. Dependable rent.
Seller: Pulling my heart strings. . . I can certainly help some. I can waive the 30% rental fee and could give you the discounted rate of $1500, but at 1020, we would be taking a loss. 
Buyer: Since I'm on fixed income I lack any way to pay more.  I understand if you need to get more.
Seller: Thanks for your interest. 
Seller:

Seller: A few weeks.  Rode it for 40miles only.  I'm just too big for it :/
Buyer: Ahhh, thank goodness I'm tall and lanky then. My budget is limited but I promise I'll take good care of the bike.
Seller: I put a lot of work into it. So I'm glad to hear. What amount you have in mind?
Buyer: Closer to 1000. My budget is 750 so I'm trying to make you a reasonable offer.
Seller: Oh no way man.  Only 40miles.  If I don't get 1500 I lose on this deal. 
Buyer: Well that's fine, that's just unreasonable; I can't offer list price, sorry.
Seller: 1500 is below list. Just saying. 
Buyer:

instruction: Given a text passage as input consisting of dialogues of negotiations between a seller and a buyer about the sale of an item, the task is to classify the text into one of the labels from the two possible outputs - 'accepted'/'rejected'. input:
Buyer: Hello I am interested in living in this 3 bedroom apartment.
Seller: Okay I am asking for 2955 for the apartment.
Buyer: Wow that seems very high. Would you be willing to take less if I prepaid the rent for a year?
Seller: It may seem high but it is only 10 minutes for San Fran. The whole year, yes.
Buyer: Well my wife is a masseuse and can provide unlimited massages at your request (1 per day) if you are willing to go below 2k per month? 
Seller: I'm not sure I'm comfortable with that, but I am willing to go to 2500, no massages.
Buyer: Well my son is a plumber and my daughter is a electrician and can provide repairs for your apartment at no cost if you're willing to go lower. My children are well behaved.
Seller: How old are your children?
Buyer: One is 29 and my daughter is 28
Seller: How about 2250?
Buyer: Heres the rub. I used to work for one of them Silicon Boys in the Valley and my company was bought out by one of those ruthless Venture Capital Firms and I am down on my luck. I am hoping for a rent of 1800 and I will do anything you want unlimited (1 thing per day) at no cost.
Seller: Sorry to hear that, I really cannot go below 2250 or I will be losing money on this.
Seller:

Buyer: Hello, I would like to pay $400. Would that work for you?
Seller: nope. That's way too low, man. At most, i could probably knock off a hundred off the price. so 650. But really that's the most I can do
Buyer: Are there other offers currently? I have seen a similar product available for $500, but it's farther away so I wanted to make a deal
Seller: There are a plenty of other drones for that price. some will be new too, but they won't be DJI phatom 4. You're paying for quality here my friend. 
Buyer: $500 is the highest I can go
Seller: tell you what. 600, and you have your drone. a perfect condition. phantom 4.  deal?
Buyer: Unfortunately I do not have enough available for that, I could round up some cash to hit $535?
Seller: I can't do that. Sorry. 600 really is the lowest. Maybe this drone isn't for you
Buyer: Yeah I will look elsewhere, thanks for your time
Seller: no problem good luck

Seller: Hi, thank you for contacting me about this awesome, secure apartment! Do you have any questions for me?

Seller: It is pet friendly, but there are some restrictions. What kind of pet(s) do you have?
Buyer: One dog. She's about 45 pounds
Seller: A dog would be fine to have at the apartment.
Buyer: Great! Are any utilities included in the monthly cost?
Seller: They are not included. We do include free internet at the building though. 
Buyer: Hmmm. Okay, what is the deposit? And is there an application fee? If so, can it be waived if I'm a full time student?
Seller: The deposit will be the same as the first months rent. I would not include an application fee since you are a full time student. 
Buyer: Okay. Thank you for that.
Seller: No problem. We also have a pet fee, but I would be willing to waive that also. Are you interested in renting this unit?
